entries: 你获得一个魔法生物的速度。在剩下的回合中，你的行走速度增加了10英尺，并且你在灵巧（（%0%））检查中具有优势。

spell.name: Quill Blast
entries: 针状的羽毛从你的皮肤里冒出来，向四面八方飞去。在以你为中心的20英尺半径范围内的所有生物必须做一个灵巧的蓄力动作。如果救赎失败，生物会受到羽毛的刺穿伤害。伤害量取决于生物的大小，如下表所示。如果救赎成功，生物会受到一半的伤害。
尺码穿透伤害
Tiny  {@dice 2d6}
小 {@dice 4d6}
中等 {@dice 6d6}
大{@dice 8d6}
Huge {@dice 10d6}
巨大的 {@dice 12d6}
除非生物是亡灵或构造物，否则在救赎失败的情况下，它在所有的救赎和能力检查中都处于劣势，直到你的下一回合结束，因为它在痛苦中挣扎。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用六级或以上的法术槽施展此法术时，法术槽等级每超过五级，球体的半径就会增加10英尺。如果使用的法术槽是第7级或更高的，那么为伤害而掷出的骰子会增加到（%0%）s，而不是（%1%）s。

spell.name: Radiant Assault
entries: 你在半径20英尺的范围内，以范围内的一个点为中心，引起一次辐射能量的爆炸。任何被卷入爆炸的生物都会受到{@damage 12d6}的辐射伤害，如果灵巧救赎成功，则会受到一半的辐射伤害。
此外，被爆炸波及的生物必须进行宪法救赎，否则会被{@condition stunned}，直到其下一回合结束。
失明或无视的生物不受此法术的影响。在更高的等级。当你使用8级以上的法术槽施放此法术时，每超过7级的法术槽等级，辐射伤害会增加（%0%）。

spell.name: Rainbow Beam
entries: 一道彩虹色的光线从你手中划过。进行一次范围性的法术攻击。一旦命中，目标会受到相当于{@dice 2d12}+你的法术能力修饰的伤害，并且在下一回合结束前会被{@condition stunned}。如果体质救赎成功，就可以否定惊吓效果。
所造成的伤害类型从下表中随机滚出。
{@damage 1d8} 颜色 损伤类型
1个红火
2 桔子酸
3 黄色闪电
4 绿毒
5 蓝色的寒冷
6 靛蓝雷霆
7 紫气东来
8个Multihued 滚动两次，忽略这个结果
如果结果显示光束是多色的，那么目标就会受到每种伤害类型的（%0%）伤害。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用四级以上的法术槽施放此法术时，每超过二级的法术槽等级，所滚动的类型伤害就会增加（%0%）。

spell.name: Rainbow Blast

m.text: a small clear gem or crystal prism worth at least 50 gp

entries: 一道五彩斑斓的能量射线从你手中射向范围内的目标。进行一次远程法术攻击。一旦命中，射线对目标造成{@damage 1d8}酸性伤害，{@damage 1d8}寒冷伤害，{@damage 1d8}火焰伤害，{@damage 1d8}闪电伤害，和{@damage 1d8}雷霆伤害。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用6级以上的法术槽施放此法术时，每超过3级的法术槽等级，每种类型的伤害量都会增加（%0%）。

spell.name: Rary's Mnemonic Enhancer

components.m: a piece of string, black dragon blood, and squid ink

entries: 你每天只能施展这个法术一次，在你开始准备当天的法术之前。从任何其他等级的法术列表中选择最多三个等级的法术（三个一级法术，一个一级法术和一个二级法术，或一个三级法术）。在24小时内，你将所选的法术视为属于你的等级的法术列表，你可以正常准备这些法术。
"一个最方便的方法，让你的敌人感到惊讶，帮助你的朋友，并变出午餐。"

spell.name: Ray of Entropy
entries: 你从你伸出的手向范围内的目标发出一道负能量射线。对目标进行一次远程法术攻击。如果攻击命中，该生物在咒语持续期间，在力量、灵巧和体质方面有劣势，并在能力检查方面有劣势。
受影响的生物可以在它的每个回合结束时尝试用魅力救赎，如果成功，咒语结束。

spell.name: Razorscales
entries: 你的皮肤会变成剃刀般锋利的鳞片。你的装甲等级不能低于15，无论你穿什么盔甲。此外，任何在持续时间内抓住你或用近战攻击击中你的生物都必须掷出一个灵巧的救赎。如果救赎失败，该生物会受到{@damage 2d4}的砍伤，如果救赎成功则会受到一半的伤害。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用3级以上的法术槽施放此法术时，每超过2级的法术槽等级，伤害会增加（%0%）。

spell.name: Read Object
entries: 你可以专注于你所接触的物体，读取最近发生的事件在上面留下的精神印象。在你施展这个咒语的时间结束时，你会了解到过去24小时内发生在该物体30英尺范围内的任何事件。你会从物体的角度看到、听到和闻到这些事件，就像你当时就在那里一样。

你还会看到最后处理该物体的生物的精神影像，也是从该物体的角度，不管该物体最后被持有的时间有多长。你收到的关于该生物的唯一信息是它当时的外表（包括对其大小的感觉），它是否独自一人（尽管你看不到任何可能在那里的其他生物），以及DM对该生物最后一次接触该物体时的情绪状态的一个或两个字的描述（例如 "愤怒"、"极其激动"、"放松"、"满意"、"完全没有情绪 "等等）。如果该生物不具备情感能力，或者它的精神状态对你来说太过陌生，你无法理解，DM会告诉你。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用七级以上的法术槽施展此法术时，如果该物品在过去一周内被多个生物处理过，你会得到在这段时间内处理过它的每个生物的相同信息，就像你通常会得到关于最后一个处理它的生物的信息一样。

spell.name: Reality Maelstrom

components.m: a golden hoop no less than 1 inch across

entries: 随着闪电和雷声的响起，一个半径为20英尺的球状空间和时间裂缝出现在你选择的范围内的一个点上。该法术有两个不同的作用区域。
首先，在漩涡中心20英尺范围内的所有重量在100磅以下的松散材料都会被吸入其中，并被传送到一个随机的存在平面。同样地，任何在20英尺范围内的生物必须进行智慧救赎，否则就会被吸进漩涡并被传送。所有被吸入大漩涡的物体和生物都会被传送到同一个存在平面。
漩涡有一个次要的暴风效应，从其中心延伸40英尺。在扩展区域内所有无人看管的、重量在50磅以下的物体都会被拉向漩涡中心20英尺，然后被吸进裂缝并被传送。在次要影响范围内的生物必须做一个灵巧的救赎动作，否则就会被吸到离漩涡主要影响范围20英尺的地方。之后，该生物必须做一个智慧救赎，否则就会被吸入裂缝并被传送到另一个平面。
请参考下表，以确定被吸入漩涡的任何物体或生物的目的地。
d%的平面目的地
01-05 耶斯加德的英雄领域
06-10 千变万化的混沌之境
11-15 大闹风云的深渊
16-20 深渊的无限层数
21-25 卡塞里的塔特里亚深渊
26-30 哈迪斯的灰色废物
31-35 盖纳的凄凉永恒
36-40 巴托的九层地狱
41-45 阿克伦的无间道战场
46-50 机械师的发条涅槃
51-55 阿卡迪亚的和平王国
56-60 天体的七个安装天体
61-65 拜托邦的双子乐园
66-70 极乐世界的福地
71-75 荒地的荒野
76-80 奥林匹亚的阿波瑞亚贫民区
81-89 外地的协约国领域
90-91火元素界
92-93 大地元素界
94-95空气元素界
96-97 水元素界
98年的Feywild
99影城
100个DM选择的双翼飞机

spell.name: Reaver's Touch
entries: 你的手的触摸会消耗目标的生命能量，使你可以牺牲动物，有时也可以牺牲其他生物，使他们的生命力成为你的。对范围内有意识的活体生物进行近战法术攻击。如果你的目标是一只野兽，你在攻击中具有优势。一旦命中，目标会受到{@damage 1d6}的坏死伤害，并且你获得相当于所受伤害一半的临时命中率（四舍五入）。当你达到5级（{@dice 2d6}）、11级（{@dice 3d6}）和17级（{@dice 4d6}）时，该法术的伤害增加{@dice 1d6}。
"有时，最简单的魔法也是最黑暗的"。

spell.name: Recitation

components.m: a sacred text of your faith

entries: 通过背诵神圣的经文或神圣教义的宣言，你对你的盟友召唤古老的神圣祝福。选择范围内最多四个生物，其中一个可以是你自己。每当目标在咒语结束前进行攻击卷或蓄力投掷时，目标可以掷出一个（%0%），并将掷出的数字加入攻击卷或蓄力投掷中。
如果目标与你崇拜同一个守护神，它可以选择为这个法术的好处掷出（%0%），而不是（%1%）。
无论你是否选择自己作为这个法术的目标，你都会在持续时间内获得一个+2的装甲等级加成。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用五级或以上的法术槽施展此法术时，你可以针对四级以上的每一个法术槽等级的一个额外生物。

spell.name: Redirect Spell
entries: 你在自己和盟友之间建立一种神奇的联系，这样，任何会伤害盟友的法术都会转到你身上。当你施展这个法术时，接触一个愿意的生物。每当你在该生物的15英尺范围内，并且它被迫对一个法术进行蓄力，或者它被一个法术攻击所针对，该法术就会针对你。如果该法术强迫你做蓄力，你就对它做你自己的蓄力，成功或失败都会受到其影响。如果该咒语是一种攻击，则攻击卷是针对你的。
如果被选中的生物离你超过一英里，这个咒语就会提前结束。

spell.name: Regal Procession
entries: 这个咒语的功能与寻找骏马类似，只是你又召唤了三匹坐骑，这些坐骑带有马齿和辔头、马鞍、马鞍毯、丝带和装饰品，以及一个高贵的旗帜。你可以选择马匹和制服的颜色，其中可以包括纹章或个人标志。

spell.name: Rejuvenate Self
entries: 在这个法术的持续时间内，在你每个回合的开始，如果你在上一回合开始后进行了一次或多次近战攻击，造成了至少10点伤害，那么你用你最有伤害力的攻击每造成5点伤害，就会获得1个临时命中点。你在一个回合内以这种方式获得的最大临时命中率等于你的法术能力修正值。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用二级或更高的法术槽施放此法术时，你的法术持续时间增加到10分钟。如果你使用三级或更高的法术槽，持续时间增加到1小时。此外，你在一回合内从这个法术获得的最大临时命中率等于你的法术能力修饰值或你用来施放这个法术的槽的等级，以较高者为准。

spell.name: Resistance, Greater
entries: 这个咒语的功能和抵抗力一样，只是目标在持续时间内所做的若干次救赎动作上获得了（%0%）的奖励。在它增加了相当于你的法术能力修饰的次数后，该法术结束。

spell.name: Resistance, Superior
entries: 这个咒语的功能和抵抗力一样，只是目标在持续时间内所做的若干次救赎动作上获得了（%0%）的奖励。在它增加了相当于你的法术能力修饰的次数后，该法术结束。

spell.name: Righteous Might
entries: 当你被圣洁的力量充满时，你会变得巨大。在持续时间内，你的体型会增加一个类别（例如从中型到大型），并且你在力量和体质检查以及蓄力方面具有优势。此外，你的皮肤会变硬，给你一个+4的交流奖励，并且你对坏死的伤害有抵抗力。
你携带或佩戴的任何装备也会增长。你的近战武器的射程增加5英尺，你用它们进行的攻击会造成额外的+2伤害。你的远程武器也会造成额外的+2伤害，但它们的范围没有变化。
施放此法术后，如果你在完成短期或长期休息前再次施放此法术，你必须在劣势下进行宪法救赎，对抗的DC等于你自己的施法DC加上你在上次完成短期或长期休息后施放此法术的次数。如果你失败了，你就会倒下（%0%）1分钟，并且施法失败。

spell.name: Sacred Strike

components.m: two drops of unholy water, and one of the caster's hairs

entries: 你召唤出一条像鞭子一样灵活的力线，从你的手中发出，并闪烁着紫色的火花。你被认为精通该武器，像普通的近战武器一样挥舞它，并且在用它进行攻击和伤害卷的时候，你可以用你的法术能力修饰值代替你的力量修饰值。它的射程为10英尺。
任何被该武器击中的生物都会遭受剧烈的疼痛，并受到相当于{@dice 4d4}+你的法术能力修正值的坏死伤害。被鞭子击中的生物必须做一个宪法救赎动作。如果失败，它在下一回合结束前进行的下一次攻击卷、能力检查或蓄力投掷中会处于不利地位。在造成伤害后，施法者会恢复相当于所受坏死伤害一半的打击点数。
被该武器击中的亡灵生物会正常受到伤害，但不会受到任何进一步的影响。此外，当你用此法术伤害一个不死生物时，你受到的伤害等于造成的坏死伤害的一半，而不是被治愈。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用6级以上的法术槽施放此法术时，每超过4级的两个法术槽等级，坏死伤害增加（%0%）。

spell.name: Saga of Foretold Doom
entries: 当你攻击时，你呼唤出一个古老的预言，这个预言似乎在很久以前就预示着你的对手会被打败。作为施展此法术的行动的一部分，对范围内的一个生物进行一次远程武器攻击。你可以使用你的法术能力而不是灵巧来进行这次攻击和伤害卷。如果攻击命中，会造成额外的（%0%）精神伤害，并且在咒语的持续时间内，对目标的所有攻击卷轴都具有优势。
在法术结束前，目标的每个回合结束时，目标必须做一个智慧救赎动作。如果失败，它将受到{@damage 6d12}的精神伤害，并在下一回合结束前受到{@condition frightened}的伤害。拯救成功时，咒语结束。
如果你在持续时间结束前再次施展该法术，该法术立即结束。

spell.name: Sanctuary, Mass
entries: 这个法术的功能和避难所一样，只是它影响到范围内最多七个生物（其中一个可能是你）。

spell.name: Scattered Form
entries: 你的身体短暂变形，破碎成一群昆虫来攻击附近的生物，然后瞬间复原。在范围内的每个生物，除了你之外，都必须在一个灵巧的蓄力动作上取得成功，如果失败则受到{@damage 2d10}穿刺伤害，如果成功则受到一半的伤害。如果至少有一个生物的蓄力动作失败，你将获得对非魔法打击、穿刺和砍击伤害的抗性，直到你下一回合结束。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用二级或以上的法术槽施放此法术时，每超过一级的法术槽等级，穿刺伤害就会增加（%0%）。

spell.name: Searing Light
entries: 一道光芒从你的手掌中射出。对范围内的目标进行一次远程法术攻击。如果你击中，目标会受到{@damage 4d10}辐射伤害。如果目标是亡灵，它将受到最大的伤害，并且必须做一个智慧救赎动作。如果救赎失败，目标会受到{@condition stunned}的伤害，直到其下一回合结束。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用四级以上的法术槽施放此法术时，每超过三级的法术槽等级，辐射伤害增加（%0%）（或对亡灵的最大伤害）。

spell.name: Serenity of Stone

m.text: a polished obsidian mirror worth 200 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: 你的身体和心灵被赋予了石头的硬度和岩浆流动的不可阻挡的力量。在咒语结束之前，你获得了对火焰伤害和非魔法的击打、穿刺和切割伤害的抵抗力，并且你在智慧和智力救赎上有优势。

spell.name: Serpent Arrows
entries: 你触碰一个装有箭矢或螺栓的箭筒。当目标被使用箭筒中的弹药的远程武器攻击击中时，目标会受到额外的{@damage 2d6}中毒伤害。即使攻击失败，目标也会受到{@damage 1d6}的毒药伤害。当击中或未击中时，该法术的魔力在弹药上结束，当从箭筒中抽出10枚弹药时，该法术结束。
每次攻击后，无论击中还是未击中，使用过的弹药都会落入离目标最近的一个无人空间，在那里它将变成一条巨大的毒蛇，由使用弹药攻击的生物控制。
由这个法术创造的巨大毒蛇对你和你的同伴很友好。它们在用弹药攻击的生物的主动权上行动，在该生物的回合结束后立即行动，但自己的行动。这些蛇服从控制它们的生物所发出的任何口头命令（不需要你采取行动）。如果该生物没有发出任何指令，则蛇群继续攻击远程攻击的目标（即使该目标已降至0点），但除自卫外不采取任何行动。
当每条蛇的命中率降至0或咒语结束时，它就会变回为一块弹药。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用五级以上的法术槽施展此法术时，每超过四级的法术槽等级，你能影响的弹药数量就增加两件。

spell.name: Serpent Missile
entries: 扭曲的能量弹从你手中跃出，攻击范围内你能看到的目标。目标必须做一个 "宪法救赎"。如果失败，目标会受到{@damage 3d4}的毒药伤害，并且在下一回合结束前会被{@condition poisoned}。如果救赎成功，它只受到一半的伤害，并且不受（%2%）的伤害。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用二级或以上的法术槽施展此法术时，你会造成额外的（%0%）毒药伤害，并且每超过一级的法术槽等级，（%1%）状态会持续一回合。

spell.name: Servant Army

components.m: a small stick crossbar to which many lengths of knotted thread are attached

entries: 你创造了一些{@condition invisible}，无意识，无形状的力量，在你的命令下执行简单的任务。掷出{@dice 3d4}来决定你创造多少个仆人。每个仆人都服从你发出的任何口头命令（不需要你采取行动）。然而，如果你不发出任何命令，仆人就会在等待你的下一个命令时无所作为。
一旦你下达命令，每个仆人都会尽其所能地执行其任务，直到任务完成。然后等待你的下一个命令。你的仆人可以跑去取东西，打开未被卡住的门，拿着椅子，以及清洁和修补。如果你仔细地指挥它，仆人也可以用来做普通的劳作任务。仆人在任务上并不比一个基本的或不熟练的平民更好或更快。

仆人可以在宴会上提供食物或酒，帮助挖土方，划船，充当搬运工，叠衣服，或在农民的田地里帮忙。每个仆人一次只能进行一项活动，但如果被要求这样做，它就会不断重复同一活动。这使你可以命令一个仆人执行一项重复性的任务，然后如果你仍在范围内，就把注意力转移到其他地方。仆人只能打开普通的门、抽屉、盖子，等等。他们的有效力量得分是2（所以他们可以搬运30磅，推、拖、举60磅）。他们可以触发陷阱之类的东西，但他们只能施加60磅的力量，而这不足以激活某些压力板和其他装置。仆人的速度是15英尺。
仆人不能以任何方式进行攻击，也不允许进行攻击卷。仆人的护甲等级为10，命中率为6。仆人不能被杀死，但他们在受到6点伤害后会消散。(他们不做拯救动作）。如果你试图将一个仆人送出法术的范围（从你目前的位置开始测量），该仆人将不再存在。

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用六级或更高等级的法术槽施展此法术时，每超过五级的法术槽等级，你会创造出{@dice 1d4}额外的仆人。当你使用7级或更高等级的法术槽施放这个法术时，法术的持续时间增加到8小时。

spell.name: Shadow Burst
entries: 一团灰色朦胧的粘液从你手中跃出，向你选择的范围内的目标飞去。粘液撕扯着受害者的眼睛，流入其口中，并尽力成为一个害虫。这道闪电从未失手，并对目标造成{@damage 2d6}的坏死伤害。
此外，目标必须做一个 "宪法救赎"。如果救赎成功，目标会受到伤害，但不会受到其他不良影响。如果目标没有成功，在整个过程中，它在能力检查、攻击卷和蓄力投掷上都处于劣势。
目标可以在其每个回合结束时尝试新的宪法救赎。如果成功，咒语结束。
"Shoon帝国的一位战斗法师曾经向我施放过这个，它是最令人不快的。那个法师已经不在我们这里了--当然，肖恩帝国也不在了。"

spell.name: Shadow Form
entries: 你将你所接触的一个人包裹在阴影地带的精华中。该生物变得更难看，其身体也变得更有延展性。在咒语结束之前，该生物在所有灵巧（（%0%））检查中获得优势。每当它进行这样的检查时，它就被视为精通{@skill Stealth}的技能。已经精通{@skill Stealth}技能的生物会在检查中加入双倍的正常熟练度加成，而不是其正常的熟练度加成。在持续时间内，这个法术的对象也可以挤过任何大于1英寸宽的缝隙。

spell.name: Shard Storm

components.m: a crystal or piece of glass

entries: 你用幽灵般的力量碎片和玻璃破碎的声音填满一个20英尺半径的球体。球体中的任何人都必须做一个灵巧的蓄力动作。拯救失败时，生物会受到{@damage 6d8}力的伤害，成功时则受到一半的伤害。在生物的下一回合开始时，碎片会继续深入挖掘，造成上一回合的一半伤害。碎片在第二轮后消失。

spell.name: Shield of Faith, Mass

components.m: a small piece of parchment with some holy text written on it

entries: 这个法术的功能和信仰之盾一样，只是它影响到你和范围内最多六个盟友。

spell.name: Shield of Warding
entries: 你触摸一个盾牌并给它注入保护性的魔法。在咒语的持续时间内，盾牌会给持有者的护身术和灵巧术带来+2奖励。

spell.name: Shield of Warding, Mass
entries: 这个法术的功能和守护之盾一样，只是它影响到你和范围内最多六个盟友。

spell.name: Shieldbearer
entries: 你触摸一个盾牌，它就会盘旋移动以保护范围内你选择的目标。盾牌在法术持续期间为该生物提供其护甲等级加成。一旦选择了盾牌的接受者，在咒语的持续时间内就不能改变。

If you choose to protect another creature within 10 feet with this spell, the ally can move up to 60 feet away from you without breaking the spell. However, if the protected creature moves beyond that range, the spell ends.

spell.name: Shifting Paths
entries: This spell hides a path or road that you choose, while also creating an illusory path that starts at a point you choose within range. The illusory path continues in a direction you choose for up to a number of miles equal to 2 x your spellcasting ability modifier. This illusory path avoids obstacles, and does not provide bridges, stairs, ladders, ramps, or other methods to travel through impassable terrain. The path will not cross cliffs or rivers more than four feet deep.

A creature following the original path must make a Wisdom saving throw when it comes to the start of the illusory path. On a failed save, the creature follows the illusory path as if it were the real one. If the path moves through difficult terrain, the creature believes the path slopes and twists to justify its reduction in speed.
On a successful save, the creature sees both paths, but the illusory path appears shadowy.

spell.name: Shroud of Undeath

components.m: dust or bone fragments from any destroyed undead creature

entries: You shroud yourself in necrotic energy, temporarily gaining the traits of undeath. Your appearance does not change except for a very slight pallor, but your creature type changes to undead for the duration of the spell.

Nonintelligent undead creatures perceive you as one of their kind, ignoring you. Intelligent undead do not immediately recognize you as alive, but may question whether you are undead. Any ability check made to determine that you are not truly undead is made with disadvantage, and you have advantage on all Charisma checks to convince others of your undead nature.

If an undead creature does target you directly with an attack or a harmful spell, that creature must make a Wisdom saving throw (an undead needn't make the save when it includes you in an area effect, such as the explosion of a fireball). On a failed saving throw, the creature must choose a new target or forfeit targeting someone else, potentially wasting the attack or spell. A creature automatically succeeds on this saving throw if it has made a successful saving throw against this effect within the last 24 hours or it has seen you target an undead creature with an attack or other harmful effect within the last 24 hours.

Because you are undead, if a spell or other effect states that it does not affect undead, then it does not affect you for the spell's duration. Conversely, effects that do affect undead (such as the Turn Undead class feature) affect you as such.

spell.name: Sign of Sealing

m.text: a crushed emerald worth at least 100 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You seal a door, chest, book, or other object that can be closed, with a magical sigil that bars entry and prevents opening. The protected object can only be opened if broken, or with knock or dispel magic. However, if the object is forced open by any means (physical or magical), the sigil explodes in a 30-foot radius for {@damage 10d4} force damage. A successful Dexterity saving throw halves the damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the amount of force damage increases by {@dice 1d4} per slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Sign of Sealing, Greater

m.text: a crushed emerald worth at least 500 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: This spell functions the same as sign of sealing, except that it can be used to seal an open space, such as a corridor, archway, or room. The spell creates a magical barrier of force that repels any creature trying to enter or pass the warded area.

In addition, doors and objects protected by this spell are strengthened, increasing their AC by 2 and their hit points by 25 (see "Objects" in chapter 8 of the Dungeon Master's Guide for details on the hit points and AC of objects). Any object protected by the spell is treated as magic, and has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical sources.

If a greater sign of sealing is broken, an explosion occurs. Each creature within 40 feet must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 10d6} force damage on a failure or half as much on a success.
This spell cannot be bypassed using a knock spell, but it can be dispelled.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the force damage increases by {@dice 1d6} per slot level above 6th.

spell.name: Simbul's Spell Sequencer

m.text: pieces of amber worth a total of 5,000 gp, which are consumed in the casting of this spell

entries: You use several pieces of ancient amber to create a matrix that contains spells you cast, frozen in time until you need them. While casting this spell you cast up to three spells of 1st through 3rd level, and you choose a command word. When the command word is spoken, all three spells take effect immediately, in the order they were cast, as if you had just cast all three of them in the same turn, and the spell ends. You make all decisions for this spell (targets, area, etc.) you would normally make as the caster. You may only have one Simbul's spell sequencer active at a time.

Only spells with a casting time of 1 action or 1 bonus action can be cast into your spell sequencer. When you create the sequencer, you reduce your maximum Hit Dice by a number equal to the total combined levels of the spell slots used to cast the spells you place in it. Your maximum number of Hit Dice does not return to normal until the spell ends. If the duration expires and you did not speak the command word, the spells are lost.

spell.name: Sinuous Horrors
entries: Your arms transform into snakes when you cast this spell. On each of your turns, you can make two melee spell attacks with the snakes, with a reach of 10 feet. On a hit, a target takes poison damage equal to {@dice 1d8} + your spellcasting modifier. In addition, the target must make a Constitution saving throw, or be {@condition poisoned} until the start of your next turn.

You cannot cast spells with somatic or material components while this spell is active, and holding things will be difficult at best. This spell cannot be dismissed (though it can be dispelled). It lasts a full minute regardless of the caster's wishes.

spell.name: Sleep of Horror
entries: A target you choose within range must make an Intelligence saving throw. If it fails the save, its next sleep is wracked with terrifying nightmares, and does not gain any of the benefits of a long rest. After that, every time it finishes a long rest, it must make the Intelligence saving throw again. If it fails, it gains no benefit from the long rest. If it succeeds, the spell ends. The spell continues until the target makes its Intelligence saving throw, or until it dies.

spell.name: Soul Scour

components.m: a pinch of dust from the bones of a lich

entries: Your touch corrupts your victim's very soul, damaging some of its mental characteristics. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within your reach. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 3d6} psychic damage and has disadvantage on Wisdom checks, Wisdom saving throws, Charisma checks, and Charisma saving throws. At the end of the target's next turn, it must make an Intelligence saving throw. If it succeeds, the spell ends. If it fails, it may make another Intelligence saving throw 1 minute later. If it succeeds, the spell ends. If it fails, the spell's effects last for the duration.

This spell can also be ended with greater restoration, heal, or wish. However, the caster of a greater restoration or heal spell must choose to affect either the Wisdom or Charisma of the target of this spell. Only the effects of this spell on ability checks and saving throws for the selected ability are affected. Thus, it requires two castings of greater restoration or heal (or one of each) to remove all the effects of this spell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: 当你使用6级以上的法术槽施放此法术时，每超过5级的法术槽等级，精神伤害增加（%0%）。

spell.name: Spark of Life
entries: You imbue an undead target with a sliver of life, making it vulnerable to conditions that usually affect the living. When you cast this spell, you make a melee spell attack against an undead target. On a hit, the undead creature must make a Wisdom saving throw or lose all of its condition immunities. The target also loses its damage resistances, and its damage immunities become resistances instead.
After the spell expires, the target knows what you have done, and will likely have a hostile attitude toward you.

spell.name: Sorcerous Scribe
entries: You summon a magical quill that writes down anything you say. The quill can write on any surface. The quill will not scribe magic spells, but any command words you would use to activate some kind of magical effect can be recorded. The quill continues writing and does not run out of ink for the duration.

spell.name: Speed of Thought
entries: You marshal psychic energies to move with speed and acrobatic grace. When you cast this spell, you gain two speed points. For the duration, as a bonus action on your turn, you can expend a speed point, granting yourself the following benefits until the end of that turn:
Your speed increases by 10 feet.
You have resistance to falling damage.
Difficult terrain does not reduce your speed.
You have a climb speed equal to your walking speed.
Opportunity attacks against you are made with disadvantage.
You add 10 feet to your long jump distance and 3 feet to your high jump distance.
You have advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) and Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks.
You can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving your hands free.
You do not sink when moving over soft or brittle terrain, such as dust, silt, mud, snow, or thin ice. This effect does not allow you to move over liquid surfaces.
If you move at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hit it with a melee weapon attack on the same turn, that attack inflicts an additional {@damage 1d4} damage.

At the end of your turn, the benefits fade entirely until you spend another speed point. If these benefits end while you are still on a vertical surface, or anywhere else where you would normally fall or sink, you immediately fall or begin to sink unless you have some other means to remain there.
This spell ends when its duration expires, when you cast this spell again, or when you have spent all your speed points. When the spell ends, any unspent speed points are lost.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: If you cast this spell with a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage you inflict with melee weapon attacks against opponents when you move 20 feet increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st. In addition, if you cast this spell with a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you gain one additional speed point for every two slot levels above 1st.

"The sorcerer who first created this spell seems to have adapted it from certain psionic disciplines practiced by esoteric mystics. It is a highly versatile spell that requires very little energy to cast. Well worth considering for thy spellbook."

spell.name: Spell Engine

m.text: a disc of polished bone, one of your tears, and a silver wheel worth 500 gp

entries: When you cast this spell, a light appears above you that provides illumination in a 30-foot radius. While studying your spellbook under this light, you may swap out any of the spells you have prepared, trading each spell you choose to swap out for a new one of the same level. Normally, preparing each new spell takes 1 minute per level of that spell, but while this spell is active, the preparation time is halved.
This spell does not refresh any spent spell slots.

spell.name: Spell Immunity

components.m: the same components as the spell being countered, if any

entries: You choose one spell of 4th-level or lower that can't affect you. The next time the chosen spell would affect you before you finish a long rest, you are unaffected by that casting of the spell, as if it had never been cast, and this spell ends.

spell.name: Sphere of Ultimate Destruction

components.m: a pinch of dust from a disintegrated creature

entries: You conjure a 5-foot diameter featureless black sphere of nothingness that disintegrates almost anything it touches. The sphere appears in an unoccupied space of your choice within range and lasts for the duration.

Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of the sphere must make a Dexterity saving throw. The target takes {@damage 12d6 + 60} force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, it is disintegrated, as if by the disintegrate spell. A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell.

As an action, you can move the sphere up to 30 feet. When you move the sphere, it flies, and you can move it any direction you wish. If you ram the sphere into a creature, that creature must make the saving throw against the sphere's damage. If you ram the sphere into a Medium or smaller object that is not being held or carried, that object is disintegrated. If you ram this sphere into a Huge or larger object, it disintegrates the 5-foot cube area of that object it strikes. If you ram the sphere into a creation of magical force (such as the wall created by a wall of force spell), it has the same effect on that magical force that it would have on an object of the same size. Magic items are not affected by this spell.

Whenever you ram the sphere into a creature or object, it uses up 10 feet of movement for every 5 feet it moves through the space occupied by that creature or object. No object or creature can be affected by the sphere more than once in the same turn.

spell.name: Stalwart Pact

m.text: incense worth 250 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: You touch a creature and grant it protection for the next 8 hours. The first time the creature's hit points drop below half its hit point maximum, it gains 25 temporary hit points, resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage, and a +1 bonus to saving throws for 1 minute. Once the effect is triggered and the duration expires, the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you gain an additional 5 temporary hit points and an extra +1 to saving throws for every two slot levels above 5th.

spell.name: Sticks to Snakes
entries: You turn a hand full of sticks into {@dice 1d4 + 1} constrictor snakes. The snakes you create with this spell are friendly to you and your companions. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions. Once the spell ends, the snakes turn back into sticks.

If another creature is holding sticks that you wish to transform, if that creature does not wish the sticks to be affected by this spell, you must make a melee spell attack as part of the action of casting this spell. If the attack misses, the spell fails.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level, you transmute the sticks into giant constrictor snakes. If you cast the spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you transmute one extra stick into a giant constrictor snake for every two slot levels above 4th.

spell.name: Stone Body

components.m: a small piece of stone from a stone golem

entries: For the duration, your body is turned into living stone. You gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from all sources except adamantine weapons. You are immune to poison damage, disease, and drowning, and to the {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition poisoned}, and {@condition stunned} conditions.
However, you also suffer disadvantage on all {@dice d20} rolls that include your Dexterity modifier. Your speed is cut in half, and you weigh three times more than normal.

spell.name: Stone Shape, Greater

components.m: soft clay, which must be worked into roughly the desired shape of the object

entries: This spell functions like stone shape, but you may shape a stone object of Huge size or smaller. The stone object you touch can be up to 15 feet in any dimension. You can also mold intricate detail into your creation, such as a stone set of double doors carved with intricate designs and up to four hinges.

spell.name: Stone Spiders
entries: You cast this spell on three small stone pebbles in range, no two of which can be more than 30 feet apart. The pebbles grow and turn into constructs that look like stone spiders. The constructs can grow up to huge in size. However, all the constructs must be the same size. The constructs you create with this spell are friendly to you and your companions. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions. Each stone spider has the same statistics as a giant spider, with the following exceptions.
Its natural Armor Class increases by 6
It has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons and immunity to poison and psychic damage
The save DC of its poison is equal to your spellcasting DC

spell.name: Stone Walk

m.text: crushed gems worth at least 5,000 gp, which the spell consumes

entries: This spell links two temples that can be any distance apart, but are both on the same plane of existence. Each temple area must have a stone platform large enough for one creature to stand upon, which is used as a teleportation pad. Before the spell is cast, each platform must be prepared by crushing 2,000 gold pieces worth of gemstones, and performing a 10-minute ritual.

To complete the spell, you must perform another 10-minute ritual using the remaining 1,000 gold pieces worth of crushed gemstones. During the final ritual, a command word is chosen that will be used to travel back and forth between the teleportation pads. When the command word is spoken, one person may be transported with up to 100 pounds of gear.

Teleportation using this spell is infallible and cannot be blocked by magical barriers or wards against teleportation. If the destination pad is blocked by solid matter, the traveller is sent to an unoccupied space nearby.

spell.name: Stony Grasp

components.m: a miniature hand sculpted from stone

entries: This spell functions like Maximillian's earthen grasp except the hand is made of stone, and it deals {@damage 3d6} bludgeoning damage on both the initial grab and the crushing damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the amount of bludgeoning damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every two slot levels above 3rd.

spell.name: Storm Cone
entries: When casting this spell, you point in a direction and emit a 60-foot cone shaped whirling vortex. As an action on each of your turns, you can change the direction of the cone up, down, or sideways by 10 feet.

The vortex whirls around any creature caught in its area, blasting it with fist-sized balls of force, and jolting it with small lightning strikes. The creature takes {@damage 5d4} bludgeoning damage from the wind buffets, and {@damage 2d4} lightning damage. A successful Dexterity saving throw halves the bludgeoning damage, but not the lightning damage.

In addition, a spellcaster caught in the cone must make a successful Constitution saving throw when casting a spell with somatic components. Though it is against your normal spellcasting DC, this saving throw is the equivalent of a roll to maintain concentration on a spell, and special benefits or other effects the creatures has on such Constitution saving throws apply.

spell.name: Storm of Elemental Fury
entries: A furious storm erupts in a 40-foot radius, 100-foot-high cylinder centered on a point you choose within range. When you cast this spell, and again at the beginning of each of your turns until the spell ends, the storm produces one of the following effects, starting with the first, and then progressing down the list.

1st turn. The storm buffets the area with a raging windstorm. No creature within the area can make ranged attacks or be the target of a ranged attack. A Small or smaller creature caught in the storm's area must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is swept up, thrown {@dice 2d6 x 10} feet in a random direction, and takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage per ten feet thrown if it lands on a solid surface. A Medium creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. A Large or larger creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw or its speed drops to 0.

A Large flying creature that fails its saving throw is blown {@dice 1d6 x 5} feet in a random direction, Medium flying creatures are blown {@dice 1d6 x 10} feet, and Small flying creatures are blown {@dice 2d6 x 10} feet away.

For the spell's duration, any creature must make a Constitution saving throw the first time it tries to cast a spell inside the area. If it fails, it cannot cast spells within the area until the spell ends. A creature that failed its saving throw can make another Constitution saving throw at the beginning of each of its turns. If it succeeds, it can cast spells normally again.
2nd turn. Rocks fall from the sky, pummelling creatures caught in the storm's area. Each creature caught in the area takes {@damage 5d6} bludgeoning damage (no save).

3rd turn. Heavy rain pours into the area, automatically extinguishing unprotected flames, and extinguishing protected flames 50% of the time. Visibility within the area is reduced to 5 feet, and the entire area of the spell becomes difficult terrain.

4th turn. Gouts of flame rain down from the sky into the storm's area. Any creature caught within the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 14d6} fire damage, or half as much if successful.

spell.name: Storm Shield
entries: You conjure a small area of whirling air that occupies a 5-foot radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. The swirling air forms a shield that blocks acid, cold, fire, lightning, and thunder damage. The shield attracts all elemental discharges and neutralizes them, granting all creatures within a 30-foot radius from its center immunity to the listed damage types. However, the shield's immunity is limited. If the shield reduces damage a creature would take to 0, the spell ends if it is not the first time the storm shield has reduced damage that particular creature would have taken to 0.

spell.name: Stormrage
entries: You gain a flying speed of 40 feet, and immunity to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage inflicted by ranged attacks. You are also immune to the effects of all wind or weather-based spells and attacks (such as control weather).

In addition, as an action on each of your turns for the duration, you can emit a single bolt of lightning from your eyes as a ranged spell attack against a target within 100 feet. You have advantage on the attack if the target you select is wearing metal armor. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 8d6} lightning damage.

spell.name: Strength of Stone
entries: The strength of elemental earth and stone infuse your body. You gain advantage on all {@dice d20} rolls that include your Strength modifier, and when you make an attack roll that gains advantage from this spell, that attack inflicts an extra {@damage 1d8} damage on a hit. This spell ends if you leave the ground at any time. The walls and ceiling count as ground if you can walk along either surface.

spell.name: Sudden Stalagmite
entries: A ten-foot tall, very sharp stalagmite erupts under your target, who must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 6d8} piercing damage, and is {@condition restrained} as the stalagmite pierces its flesh. On a successful save, the target still takes damage, but is not {@condition restrained}, and the spell ends.

A creature {@condition restrained} by this spell cannot escape until it uses an action to free itself by making a successful Strength saving throw, or until another creature within 5 feet of it succeeds on a Strength check against your spellcasting DC. When the target is freed, it takes an additional {@damage 2d6} piercing damage, and the spell ends.

spell.name: Sudden Transposition
entries: With a single word of magical power, you cause two creatures to swap places. Choose two Small or Medium creatures that you can see within range. You can only choose two creatures which are either standing on the same surface or standing on surfaces which are physically connected by solid ground or structures.

A creature which is unwilling to be transposed gains a Charisma saving throw against this effect. If neither creature makes a successful saving throw, both creatures are teleported, with each reappearing in the space previously occupied by the other.

spell.name: Summons of Justice
entries: You sacrifice some of your own vitality to hurl two rays of holy energy that compel your enemies to come forward. You can hurl your rays at one target or divide them among multiple targets. Make a ranged spell attack for each ray against a target within range. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 2d6} radiant damage, and you can pull it up to 15 feet closer to you.

You also take 2 points of radiant damage for each ray that hit, which cannot be reduced by any means. Until the start of your next turn, attack rolls against you have advantage, and you have disadvantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you create one additional ray for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Symphonic Nightmare

m.text: an exceptionally crafted small statue of an opened skull with a miniature orchestra within the cavity, which is worth at least 1,000 gp

entries: A creature you touch loses its ability to sleep restfully for the spell's duration. Instead of peaceful fantasies, the subject's dreams are filled with a discordant orchestra. Starting when the subject next finishes a long rest, it has disadvantage on Wisdom checks and Wisdom saving throws for the duration of the spell.
In addition, until the spell ends, whenever the subject finishes a long rest, it must roll a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, it does not gain the benefits of that long rest.

The subject is immune to the dream spell while under the influence of this spell. This spell can be ended by a remove curse or greater restoration spell cast using a 7th-level or higher spell slot, in addition to being dispelled normally.

spell.name: Synostodweomer
entries: For the duration, you can turn another spell you cast into healing energy. Instead of its normal effect, the spell you cast is held until you touch another creature before the duration expires; the creature you touch regains {@dice 1d10} hit points per level of the spell slot used to cast the triggering spell, and then this spell ends.

For example, you could cast this spell, and while you maintain concentration, you could cast mind blank using an 8th-level spell slot, and before the duration expires, you could touch a creature and cause it to regain {@dice 8d10} hit points.

spell.name: Tactical Precision
entries: When this spell is cast, you and up to six creatures you choose within range have greater insight into each other's actions.

When an ally affected by this spell makes a melee weapon attack against a creature that is within 5 feet of another ally affected by this spell, they gain advantage on the attack roll and deal an extra {@damage 1d6} damage of that weapon's type if the attack hits.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the bonus to hit increases by 1 and the weapon damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Tearing Claws
entries: Spectral draconic claws strike out from your body, slashing at your foes and shoving them backward. Each creature in a 15foot cone emanating from you must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d10} slashing damage and is pushed 5 feet away from you. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and isn't pushed.
Creatures that only have hit points equal to half their hit point maximum or fewer have disadvantage on the saving throw, and are pushed back 15 feet on a failed saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by a {@dice 1d10} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Thundering Armor
entries: You infuse a creature's armor with pulsing energy, increasing its protection and knocking a single foe away with an intense reverberation. Choose a friendly creature within range that is wearing armor. The subject gains a +2 bonus to AC until the end of its next turn. You can also choose a hostile creature within 5 feet of the ally. That hostile creature must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 2d8} thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from your ally. On a successful save, the target takes half damage and is not pushed.

You cannot cast this spell on yourself. At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd-level or higher, the thunder damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Thunderlance
entries: You transform a metal spear into a lance that embodies the power of a thunder storm. You can wield the lance to make melee spell attacks against enemies within 20 feet of you.

As part of the action used to cast the spell, and again by using an action on each of your turns for the duration, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 20 feet. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 6d6} thunder damage. If this lance leaves your hand for any reason, such as if you are disarmed or otherwise forced to drop it, you can call it back to your hand using a bonus action.

spell.name: Thunderous Reprisal

time.condition: which you take in response to being damaged by a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see

entries: You blast your enemies away in a wave of thunder and destruction. Each creature within 30 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 4d8} thunder damage, or half as much damage on a successful save. In addition, creatures that fail their saving throw are pushed 10 feet away from you and become {@condition deafened} until the end of your next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the thunder damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Trait Rip
entries: You can rob a creature of one of its unique traits and give it to an ally. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within your reach. On a hit, you choose one special or racial trait which you know the creature possesses (such as one you have seen it use) and remove it from the creature until the spell ends. For example, if you removed the Amphibious trait from an aboleth or a water genasi, that creature would no longer be able to breathe both air and water.

When you cast this spell, you choose a second target, which must be another willing creature within 30 feet. Until the spell ends, that creature gains the racial or special trait you removed from the first target.

However, the Ability Score Increase racial trait, Legendary Resistance, Innate Spellcasting, or Spellcasting traits are not affected by this spell, nor are any other traits that are either not listed under the traits section of the stat block or not listed among the traits it receives for being a member of a certain race. You could not, for example, remove an action or legendary action with this spell, nor could you remove its Armor Class or Passive {@skill Perception}.

The DM may also rule that certain traits are too intrinsic to the nature of a creature to be removed, such as the Water Form trait of a water elemental. However, if a creature has no traits you can affect with this spell, the DM will inform you before you use an action to cast the spell.
At the end of each of the first target's turns, it can make a Constitution saving throw against the spell. On a success, the spell ends.

spell.name: Transmute Rock to Lava
entries: You transform a natural area of stone within range of up to 10 cubic feet in volume into an equal volume of red hot lava.

Any creature caught in the area when the spell is cast must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes {@damage 15d6} fire damage, or half as much on a successful one. A creature that starts its turn in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw and take fire damage until it is no longer in the affected area.

If the rock transformed by this spell supported a structure, that structure takes the fire damage (and ignites if it is flammable), and also takes extra bludgeoning damage equal to half the fire damage. If a structure drops to 0 hit points, it collapses and potentially damages nearby creatures, as described in the earthquake spell.

spell.name: Unbinding

components.m: a loadstone and a pinch of saltpeter

entries: When you cast this spell, a flash of magical energy spreads out from you in a 120-foot radius. This spell acts as a dispel magic spell cast using a 9th-level spell slot targeting all objects and structures within range. Creatures within range are also targeted, but spells affecting those creatures are only dispelled if they are causing those creatures to be {@condition charmed}, {@condition paralyzed}, or {@condition stunned}. The spell does not restore or affect creatures turned to stone, or release bonded creatures from service, such as familiars, {@condition invisible} stalkers, and genies.
Also, the spell does not penetrate or affect an antimagic field in any way. This spell does not affect objects that are being worn or carried by a creature.
Finally, any magical traps attached to any objects affected by this spell are triggered immediately the moment spells affecting those objects are destroyed.

spell.name: Undeath's Eternal Foe
entries: Select up to seven friendly creatures within range (one of which may be you). Each subject is surrounded by a spectral ghost-like aura that grants it a +4 bonus to its Armor Class against undead creatures.

In addition, affected creatures gain the benefits of the death ward spell, and automatically succeed on saving throws they are forced to make against the abilities of undead creatures, except when such saving throws are caused by spells.

spell.name: Undersong
entries: When you cast this spell, a familiar and soothing song wells up in your mind. The song does not distract you from any task at hand--on the contrary, by humming along to the tune you can focus your mind with ease. For the duration, whenever you make a Constitution saving throw to maintain your concentration on a spell, you can choose to make a Charisma ({@skill Performance}) check, substituting the result of that roll for the result of a Constitution save.

spell.name: Unexpected Clarity

time.condition: which you take when you score a critical hit with an attack roll

entries: When an astonishing strike opens a new opportunity for you in battle, you focus your mental energies to take full advantage of it. As part of the reaction used to cast this spell, you make a further melee weapon attack against a creature within your reach. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects. In addition, the target takes an additional {@damage 1d12} psychic damage, and is {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the psychic damage increases by {@dice 1d12} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Unluck
entries: You manipulate what was once an ode to fate, speaking it in reverse and warping the weave of fortune. Choose one target within range to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the target takes {@damage 3d6} psychic damage and has disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn. On a success, the target takes half the damage, but suffers no other ill effects.
In addition, whether the target fails or succeeds on its saving throw, you can choose one ally within 60 feet to gain advantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Unyielding Roots
entries: You touch a creature that is standing on the ground (such as soil, rock, or a street). For the duration, the creature's speed is reduced to 0, and all attempts to move it from its current space automatically fail, whether or not the creature is willing to be moved. Effects that would move the creature only succeed if they would also move all solid ground within 5 feet of it.

In addition, the affected target gains life preserving energy from its connection with the ground. Until the spell ends, the creature gains advantage on Strength, Constitution, and Wisdom saving throws, it is immune to poison damage and the {@condition poisoned} condition, and it regains hit points equal to its maximum number of Hit Dice at the start of each of its turns.

spell.name: Updraft
entries: When you cast this spell, a small vortex of swirling air forms beneath your feet, lifting you upward. You can rise a number of feet equal to 20 x your spellcasting ability modifier. You can also move a number of feet horizontally during any part of the movement equal to 5 x your spellcasting ability modifier. At the end of the turn in which you cast this spell, you float gently to the ground if you are still aloft.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can rise an additional 20 feet, and move horizontally by another 5 feet, for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Valiant Fury
entries: Choose either yourself or a creature of your choice that you can see within range as the spell's target. The recipient gains advantage on Strength, Constitution, and Dexterity ability checks and saving throws for the duration. In addition, until the spell ends, the subject gains advantage on attack rolls that include its Dexterity or Strength modifier. When the subject takes the attack action on its turn, it can make an extra melee weapon attack as a bonus action.

spell.name: Venom Bolt

components.m: a drop of venom from any sort of poisonous snake

entries: A beam forming a 5-foot wide by 100-foot line of caustic green energy blasts from your eye, mouth, fingertip, or tail tip in a direction you choose. Every creature in the affected area must roll a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 3d6} acid damage on a failure or half as much on a success.

In addition, the blast poisons the area it struck with toxic energy and nauseating fumes for the duration. When a creature enters the affected area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 2d8} poison damage and become {@condition poisoned} for the duration. If it succeeds, it takes half the damage.

A creature that is {@condition poisoned} by this spell but is no longer within the affected area can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a success, it is no longer {@condition poisoned}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the acid damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Vigor
entries: The subject regains 1 hit point, and at the start of each of its turns until the spell ends, it regains 1 more hit point if its current hit point total is less than half its hit point maximum.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing the subject gains at the start of each of its turns increases by 1 hit point for every slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Vigorous Circle
entries: When casting this spell, choose up to seven creatures within range (one of whom may be you). For the duration, each creature regains 1 hit point at the beginning of each of its turns.
This spell does not regenerate lost limbs, or heal damage from thirst, starvation, or suffocation.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the number of hit points a creature regains increases by 1 for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Vipergout

components.m: a snakeskin, which you swallow during the casting of the spell

entries: You summon vipers which leap forth from your mouth to attack your enemies. Choose three unoccupied spaces that you can see within 30 feet. Three giant poisonous snakes under your control leap from your mouth to land in each space.
Until the spell ends, on each of your turns, you can summon up to three more giant poisonous snakes from your mouth as a bonus action.

Giant poisonous snakes created by this spell are considered fiends. They are immune to fire damage and poison damage, and they can see normally in darkness, both magical and nonmagical, to a distance of 120 feet.

If you have six or more summoned snakes present when your turn ends, the snakes begin to swallow each other whole. At the end of your turn, half the snakes vanish unless there are five or fewer of them. For each snake that vanishes, one of the remaining snakes gains temporary hit points equal to the hit points of that vanished snake. No snake can gain more than 10 temporary hit points in this way at a time.

The snakes are friendly to you and your companions. They act on your initiative, immediately after your turn ends, but have their own turns. For the duration of the spell, you can issue mental commands to the snakes (no action required by you), and they obey any commands that you issue to them. If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.
Each snake vanishes when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends, leaving only an empty snakeskin.

The spell ends early once you have summoned a total of 24 snakes or if you choose to stop concentrating on it. Until the spell ends, you cannot speak, cast spells with verbal components, or activate items that require speech.

spell.name: Virtuous Strike
entries: As part of the action used to cast this spell, make a melee weapon attack against a creature within range. On a hit, the target suffers the attack's normal effects, and divine light invested in your weapon fills you with resolve. If the target forces you to make a saving throw before the start of your next turn, the target takes an additional {@damage 1d6} psychic damage, you gain a bonus on the saving throw equal to the psychic damage inflicted, and the spell ends.

The spell's damage increases when you reach higher levels. At 5th level, the melee attack deals an extra {@damage 1d6} radiant damage to the target, and the psychic damage the target takes for forcing you to make a saving throw increases to {@dice 2d6}. Both damage rolls increase by {@dice 1d6} at 11th level and 17th level.

spell.name: Visage of the Deity
entries: When casting this spell, you transform into the likeness of a celestial or fiend, depending on your faith.
If you worship a good-aligned god, then you have the following qualities while transformed:
You grow feathered wings that allow you to fly at twice your normal speed
You gain a +1 bonus to your AC
You gain {@sense darkvision} to 60 feet
You gain resistance to acid, cold, and lightning damage
You gain immunity to disease
You gain advantage on poison saving throws
You gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons
You gain resistance to damage from spells
You gain advantage on all ability checks and all saving throws against spells.
If you worship an evil-aligned god, then you have following qualities while transformed:
You gain bat-like wings that allow you to fly at your normal speed
You gain a +1 bonus to your AC

You gain a multiattack action with one bite and two claw attacks. If your size is Medium or larger, your bite deals {@damage 1d6} piercing damage, and your claws deal {@damage 1d4} slashing damage. If your size is small, then your bite deals {@damage 1d4} piercing damage, and your claws deal {@damage 1d3} slashing damage. These are considered melee weapon attacks with which you are proficient.
You gain {@sense darkvision} to 60 feet
You gain immunity to poison
You gain resistance to acid, cold, lightning, and fire damage
You gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons
You gain resistance to damage from spells
You gain advantage on all ability checks and all saving throws against spells.
If you do not worship a god of good or evil alignment, you can choose either transformation.

spell.name: Voice of Battle
entries: You emit a powerful battle cry that hammers your enemy, distracting it from a nearby ally. Choose a creature within range that is adjacent to one of your allies. That target must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the target fails the saving throw, it takes {@damage 1d6} thunder damage and you can choose one ally that is within 5 feet of the target. That ally can use its reaction to move up to 10 feet without provoking an opportunity attack from the target, and the spell ends.

This spell's damage increases when you reach higher levels, dealing {@damage 2d6} thunder damage at 5th level, {@dice 3d6} at 11th level, and {@dice 4d6} at 17th level. damage from this effect take extra bludgeoning damage equal to half the fire damage. If a structure drops to 0 hit points, it collapses and potentially damages nearby creatures, as described in the earthquake spell.
This spell leaves its entire area a blackened ruin incapable of supporting plant life for a full year. After that time, however, the ground is more fertile than it was before the spell was cast.

"A powerful planar mage of my acquaintance, the Crowngold, late of Ylraphon, informs me that this spell not only works perfectly well on the bottom of the sea, but also in elemental planes where molten earth does not flow beneath the surface, such as the Planes of Air and Water. In fact, she has found it useful in such places to quickly expand a small mote of earth into a substantial island of solid rock. But first one must find some earth to stand on!"

spell.name: Volcanic Eruption

components.m: a blade carved of obsidian, which shatters when the spell is cast

entries: You draw molten lava up through the ground, which erupts to fill a sphere with a radius of 360 feet. The entire radius (even the sky above it and the underground beneath it) immediately becomes difficult terrain for the duration, and each creature within that radius must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 2d6} fire damage, and its walking speed is reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half as much damage and suffers no other effects. A creature with full cover is still affected, but automatically succeeds on its saving throw. You take no damage from this spell, and automatically succeed on saving throws against it.

Until the spell ends, if you can see some part of the area of the spell, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to force each creature in the area to make another saving throw or suffer the above effects. You cannot cast this spell if you are more than 360 feet away from an area of solid ground at least 10 feet wide, but once it is cast, it lasts for the duration, even if you are out of range.

A creature wearing metal armor who fails its saving throw against this effect takes {@dice 2d6} additional fire damage, and has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the start of its next turn (as if it were affected by the heat metal spell).

Firenewts, earth-based elemental creatures (such as gargoyles), or fire-based elemental creatures (such as salamanders), do not take damage from this spell. Instead, such a creature is healed, regaining hit points equal to half the fire damage inflicted. Only firenewts or creatures of the elemental type can benefit from this effect.
The volcanic eruption damages objects in the area and ignites flammable objects that aren't being worn or carried. Structures in contact with the ground in the area that take fire

spell.name: Vortex
entries: When this spell is cast, a 20-foot radius sphere of swirling air appears at a point you can see within range. A creature caught in the area when the vortex appears or starts its turn there must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d6} bludgeoning damage from the battering winds.

Thereafter, the spellcaster can use an action to call a lightning bolt from the vortex. The lightning bolt streaks out up to 120 feet toward a target you can see within range. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 4d6} lightning damage or half as much on a successful save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the bludgeoning damage from the winds increases by {@dice 1d6}, and you can call one additional lightning bolt for each slot level above 7th.

spell.name: Wail of the Banshee

components.m: the flayed face of someone killed by a banshee

entries: You howl with raw, soul-searing hate. Every creature within range that is not undead or a construct within you must make a successful Constitution saving throw or drop to 0 hit points. Any creature whose hit points are already at 0 must make an immediate death saving throw. If the saving throw is successful, it counts as one success. However, if the saving throw fails, the creature dies.

spell.name: Wailing Wind
entries: When this spell is cast, you set up a magical warning system. Choose an area within range that is an exit or entrance to an indoor or underground area. The total size of the entrance or exit chosen must fit within a 40-foot cube. Until the spell ends, a wailing, whistling wind blows toward you whenever a Tiny or larger creature touches or enters the warded area.

You do not have to be in the area to receive the knowledge this spell provides. The wailing wind will seek you out as long as you are within 500 feet of the target area. The wailing wind has a distinct audible sound that can be heard by any creature, though they do not know what it means unless they are familiar with this spell.

spell.name: War Cry
entries: When casting this spell, you let out a battle cry and charge toward your enemies. As part of the action used to cast the spell, you can move up to your full speed and make one melee weapon attack with advantage. On a hit, the attack deals an extra {@damage d10} damage of the weapon's type.
In addition, if you hit with the attack, your foe must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you deal an extra {@damage d10} damage on a successful attack for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Watchware

m.text: a sprinkling of rare sands and powdered reagents worth at least 500 gp

entries: You create a mystical connection with a single inanimate object you touch. When that object is damaged, moved, or touched at any later time, you are instantly aware of this fact. If another creature physically touches the warded object, you receive a mental image of the creature.
For purposes of divination spells (such as scrying), you are considered to have first-hand knowledge of the creature who triggered the effect as if you had met.
This effect activates when the object is disturbed for any reason, whether someone touches it or pokes it with a pole, a cat walks upon it, or an earthquake knocks it over.
This spell ends as soon as the effect is activated. Because of its costly material components, most spellcasters reserve this spell to protect valuable, out-of-the-way items.

This spell is considered a magical trap. It can be detected with an Intelligence ({@skill Arcana} or {@skill Investigation}) check made against your spellcasting DC, but it can only be dispelled magically. You can designate a password that allows another creature to handle the object without sounding the mental alarm if you choose.

spell.name: Weaken Ability
entries: Your curse greatly weakens a creature in your presence. Choose one ability score. One creature of your choice within range makes a saving throw with that ability score. On a failure, the target has disadvantage on checks and saving throws with the chosen ability score. In addition, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls using the chosen ability score, and deals only half damage with such attacks if they are weapon attacks.

At the end of each of the first target's turns, it can make a saving throw against the spell. It makes the saving throw with the ability score you chose, but the disadvantage inflicted by this spell does not affect saving throws against it. On a successful save, the spell ends. This spell can also be ended with greater restoration, or heal.

spell.name: Weightless Pursuit

time.condition: which you take when a creature that started its turn within 30 feet of you ends its turn more than 30 feet away from you

entries: You can jump with supernatural ability and run up walls to pursue your opponent. Choose one creature within 60 feet that has just ended its turn more than 30 feet away after starting its turn within 30 feet of you. Until this spell ends, you gain the ability to move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings (while leaving your hands free). You also gain a climb speed equal to your walking speed, and your jumping distance is doubled.

In addition, as part of the reaction used to cast this spell, you can immediately fly a number of feet equal to or less than your walking speed, ending this movement in an empty space within 30 feet of the creature. This space cannot be above the creature, and you cannot end your movement farther away from your original space than the creature.
Moreover, for the duration, you have resistance against all damage from falling, and you take no damage when you fall less than 100 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the duration is increased to 10 minutes. If the spell slot used is 3rd level or higher, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed for the duration.

spell.name: Whip of Flame

components.m: lump of charcoal and some of the caster's hair

entries: A whip of flame extends from one of your hands. The whip is a melee weapon with a reach of 10 feet, with which you are considered proficient. It sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. As part of the action of casting this spell, and again as an action on each of your turns for the spell's duration, you can make a melee spell attack with the whip, dealing fire damage on a hit equal to {@dice 3d4} + your spellcasting ability modifier.

spell.name: Whip of Pain

components.m: a drop of blood and some hair

entries: A thin red line stretches from your palm, which you wield as a whip. The whip counts as a magical weapon with a reach of 10 feet, with which you are considered proficient. As part of the action of casting this spell, and again as an action on each of your turns for the spell's duration, you can make a melee spell attack. Any target struck takes {@damage 3d6} psychic damage, and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the victim has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn due to the intense pain.

spell.name: Whirling Blade
entries: You throw the weapon in your hand, which is then animated to strike on its own, attacking creatures in a line 60 feet long and 5 feet wide emanating from you. Choose up to four creatures you can see within the line. Make a melee spell attack against each target. On a hit, a target takes {@damage 3d8} magical damage of the same type that the weapon would inflict.

After these attacks, the weapon remains floating in midair in a space of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of whichever one of your chosen targets was farthest away from you, whether you hit that target or not.

After this spell is cast, until the end of your next turn, if the weapon is still on the same plane of existence as you, you can summon that weapon as a bonus action on your turn, causing it to teleport instantly to your hand.

spell.name: Whirlwind, Greater
entries: This is a more potent version of whirlwind. The whirlwind touches the ground at a point you choose within range. Its area is a 20-foot radius by 60-foot high cylinder centered on that point. Until the spell ends, you can use an action on each of your turns to move the whirlwind up to 30 feet in any direction along the ground. The whirlwind sucks up any large or smaller objects in its area that aren't secured, worn, or carried by any creature.

A creature must make a Dexterity saving throw the first time on a turn that it enters the whirlwind's area, or when the whirlwind enters its space, including when the whirlwind first appears. A creature takes {@damage 15d6} bludgeoning damage on a failed saving throw, or half that on a successful one. In addition, a Huge or smaller creature that fails its save must succeed on a Strength saving throw or become {@condition restrained} within the whirlwind. A {@condition restrained} creature is pulled 5 feet higher at the start of each of its turns while inside the whirlwind unless it is already at the top. The creature moves with the whirlwind and falls when the spell ends, unless it has some means to stay aloft.

A creature {@condition restrained} by the whirlwind can use an action to make a Strength or Dexterity check against the spellcaster's save DC. On a success, the creature is no longer {@condition restrained}, and it is hurled {@dice 3d6 x 10} feet in a random direction. A thrown creature takes {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage per 10 feet thrown if it strikes a solid object.

spell.name: Wind at Back
entries: When this spell is cast, choose six creatures. For the duration, you and the selected creatures double your overland travelling speeds.
This spell has no effect on the speed of creatures during combat.

spell.name: Wind Tunnel
entries: When this spell is cast, you summon the winds around you to improve the accuracy of your allies' ranged weapon attacks. Each ally within range has advantage on ranged weapon attacks for the duration.

spell.name: Wrack
entries: Your victim must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature collapses in pain. Boils and blisters appear all over its skin and then pop, covering it with vile fluids as its eyes fill with blood, causing the victim to be {@condition paralyzed} and {@condition blinded} until the spell ends.

The victim can attempt a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If it succeeds, the spell ends. Even after the spell ends, the victim has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until it finishes a short or long rest.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the duration increases to concentration, up to 1 hour for a 6th or 7th level spell slot, or concentration, up to 1 day for an 8th level or higher spell slot.

spell.name: Wraithstrike
entries: Your hands and any weapons you hold become skeletal and insubstantial and can easily pass through armor. Until the end of your next turn, you gain advantage on melee weapon attacks against creatures wearing armor or using shields.

spell.name: Wrathful Castigation
entries: Choose a target you can see within range. The chosen creature must make a Wisdom saving throw or fall to the ground {@condition incapacitated}, while writhing in pain. On a successful save, the spell ends.

A creature that starts its turn {@condition incapacitated} by this spell must make a Wisdom saving throw as its mind is flooded with the thoughts of all its failures. On a failed save, the creature remains {@condition incapacitated}. However, if the creature fails its saving throw a total of three times before making a successful save, it dies in agony overwhelmed by the compounding pressure of all its failures.

spell.name: Xorn Movement

components.m: a scale from a xorn's hide

entries: You or a creature you touch can travel through the earth itself without leaving any mark of passage. The target gains a burrow speed equal to its walking speed. In addition, when burrowing through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone, the target leaves its hands free and doesn't disturb the material it moves through. The recipient can extend the magical aura of this spell to bring any object or creature it is carrying or grappling as it burrows. The target enjoys no special protections from this effect except for the cover of the stone or earth around it.

If this spell or its effects end on the target or any other object or creature placed within stone or earth by means of this spell, you or any such object or creature are expelled from the earth, moving at 60 feet per round toward the nearest open space large enough to fit into comfortably and taking {@damage 6d6} bludgeoning damage upon exiting into that space.

spell.name: Your Glorious Sacrifice
entries: Make a ranged spell attack against a target within range. If the attack hits, the target takes {@damage 5d4} necrotic damage and its speed is reduced by half until the end of your next turn.

As part of the same action used to cast this spell, before you make the ranged spell attack, you may choose to inflict necrotic damage equal to {@dice 1d4} plus your spellcasting ability modifier on a willing ally within 5 feet of you. This damage cannot be reduced or prevented in any way. If you inflict this damage on an ally, you gain advantage on the ranged spell attack roll against your main target. In addition, if the ranged spell attack hits, your target takes additional poison damage equal to the necrotic damage you dealt to your ally.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the necrotic damage you inflict on your target and your ally both increase by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Zeal
entries: You invoke a divine shield that protects you while you close the distance with a chosen opponent. Choose one hostile creature within 120 feet. Until the spell ends, opportunity attack rolls made against you by creatures besides your chosen target have disadvantage. In addition, you can move through the space of any creature that is not your chosen target as if it were an ally. At the end of each turn, you must be closer to the target than you were when you started moving, or the spell ends.
The spell also ends if the creature is {@condition stunned} or {@condition incapacitated} by any means.

spell.name: Zealot Pact
entries: You touch a subject and choose one of the following creature types: aberration, celestial, dragon, elemental, fey, fiend, or undead. Until the spell ends, the subject has advantage on melee attack rolls against creatures of the chosen type and inflicts {@dice 1d10} additional radiant damage when it hits such a creature.

itemGroup.name: Ring of Wizardry
entries: There are four distinct types of this ring (ring of wizardry I, II, III, and IV), each of which grants you additional spell slots. If you have spell slots of the level listed in the table below for your type of ring, the number of spell slots of that level you have is doubled. The details for each ring type are shown in the following table:
Ring I II III IV
Benefit doubles 1st level spell slots doubles 2nd level spell slots doubles 3rd level spell slots doubles 4th level spell slots

entries.name: Random Properties
entries: Roll for new random properties on the "Artifact Properties table" (chapter 7 of the Dungeon Master's Guide) every time you recover enough pieces to reach a new level.

One piece of the rod has the following randomly determined properties: 1 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property  1 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Detrimental Properties|dmg|minor detrimental} property

Three pieces have the following randomly determined properties: 1 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} property  1 {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property  1 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Detrimental Properties|dmg|minor detrimental} property 1 {@table Artifact Properties; Major Detrimental Properties|dmg|major detrimental} property

Five pieces of the rod have the following randomly determined properties: 2 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} properties  1 {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} property  2 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Detrimental Properties|dmg|minor detrimental} properties 1 {@table Artifact Properties; Major Detrimental Properties|dmg|major detrimental} property

All seven pieces of the rod have the following randomly determined properties: 3 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Beneficial Properties|dmg|minor beneficial} properties  2 {@table Artifact Properties; Major Beneficial Properties|dmg|major beneficial} properties  3 {@table Artifact Properties; Minor Detrimental Properties|dmg|minor detrimental} properties 2 {@table Artifact Properties; Major Detrimental Properties|dmg|major detrimental} properties

entries.name: Powers of Individual Pieces
entries: If you have one section, you can sense the next closest section. You do not know how far away the piece is, just a general sense of the direction and whether or not it is on the same plane. Each section is also engraved with a word that most sages refer to as the section's name. The DC of saving throws against spells of 1st-level or higher cast with parts of the rod is 15.

entries.name: Ruat (4-inch section)
entries: This section has 3 charges. You can expend one charge to cast cure wounds as a 2nd-level spell. It regains 3 charges at dawn.

entries.name: Caelum (5-inch section)
entries: This section has 3 charges. You can expend one charge to cast slow. It regains 3 charges at dawn.

entries.name: Fiat (6-inch section)
entries: This section has 5 charges. You can expend one charge to cast haste. It regains 5 charges at dawn.

entries.name: Justitia (8-inch section)
entries: You know the ray of frost cantrip as long as you wield this rod.

entries.name: Ecce (10-inch section)
entries: This section has 1 charge. You can expend the charge to cast true seeing. It regains 1 charge at dawn.

entries.name: Lex (12-inch section)
entries: This section has 3 charges. You can expend one charge to cast hold monster (as a 5th-level spell). It regains 3 charges at dawn.

entries.name: Rex (15-inch section)
entries: This section has 1 charge. You may expend it to cast heal (as a 6th-level spell). It regains 1 charge at dawn.

entries.name: Synergetic Powers
entries: As pieces of the rod are connected, new powers are revealed. The individual pieces keep their powers. The new powers only appear if the sections are connected.
Two pieces. You can cast the fly spell at will without using a spell slot.
Three pieces. The DC of saving throws against spells of 1st level or higher cast with the assembled pieces of the rod is 18.
Four pieces. You can choose to have advantage on a save or ability check three times a day. This ability refreshes at dawn.
Five pieces. For each piece of the rod, increase the number of charges it has by 1.
Six pieces. The DC of saving throws against spells of 1stlevel or higher cast with the assembled pieces of the rod is 20.
Seven pieces. You gain resistance to all nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

entries.name: Destroying the Rod
